## Checklist
<!-- Mark completed items with an 'x' -->

### Code Quality:
- [ ] My code follows the project's style guidelines
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings
- [ ] I have run `go fmt` and `go vet`
- [ ] I have run golangci-lint (if available)

### Testing:
- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [ ] New and existing unit tests pass locally with my changes
- [ ] I have tested on multiple platforms (if applicable)

### Documentation:
- [ ] I have updated the documentation accordingly
- [ ] I have updated the README (if needed)
- [ ] I have updated CONTRIBUTING.md (if needed)
- [ ] I have updated STATUS.md (if needed)
- [ ] I have added/updated code comments

### Dependencies:
- [ ] I have not added new dependencies (or justified why they're needed)
- [ ] I have updated go.mod and go.sum (if dependencies changed)

### Breaking Changes:
- [ ] My changes do NOT break backward compatibility
- [ ] OR I have documented the breaking changes below
